ENFORCEMENT_ACTION.description: Documents actions taken against a Public Water System (PWS), laboratory, or operator. Includes requirements that must be met in order to rectify a failure to perform under the Public Water Supply Supervision (PWSS) Program. Enforcement actions are informal and formal. They may be issued by the Primacy State (or its representative) or the EPA. Examples: administrative and civil/criminal legal actions, warning notices, citations, orders to follow water treatment procedures, orders to follow sampling requirements, orders to resolve violations, moratoriums on connections, temporary injunctions, restraining orders, penalties, and orders to comply with reporting requirements. Example descriptors: type of enforcement action, directed actions, and milestone date(s).

ENFORCEMENT_ACTION_TYPE_CODE.description: A designated attribute which indicates the coded type of enforcement follow up action was taken by a federal or state agency. It also indicates whether enforcement action was formal, informal, subcategory, or others.

ENFORCEMENT_COMMENT_TEXT.description: This column provides a description of the enforcement action code (EnfActionType).

ENFORCEMENT_DATE.description: A value that represents the calendar date on which an enforcement action was taken by the State or EPA against a public water system.

ENFORCEMENT_ID.description: A designed attribute which, along with the water system ID (PWSID), assures uniqueness of enforcement action.

ORIGINATOR_CODE.description: Code that indicates if the enforcement action was initiated by an EPA Region (R) or by a state, territory, or tribe (S).

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

GEOGRAPHIC_AREA.description: Information on political units established by geographic boundaries, such as state, town, or county served by a Water System.

ANSI_ENTITY_CODE.description: ANSI code for the county, city, or legal statistical area. Taken with the ANSI state code, uniquely identifies a county (or other area) within the country

AREA_TYPE_CODE.description: Indicates the area type, which is TR (Tribal), CN (County), ZC (Zip Code), CT (City), or IR (Indian Reservation)

CITY_SERVED.description: A City served by the PWS.

COUNTY_SERVED.description: A County served by the PWS.

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

GEO_ID.description: System generated ID that uniquely identifies PWSID and Area Type record.

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

PWS_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: Code that indicates the activity status of the public water system.

PWS_TYPE_CODE.description: A system-generated coded value which classifies the water system according to federal requirements. It includes Community Water Systems (CWS), Non-Transient Non-Community Water Systems (NTNCWS), and Transient Non-Community Water Systems (TNCWS).

STATE_SERVED.description: A coded value which identifies the state (or EPA Region--01-10) in which the water system is located.

TRIBAL_CODE.description: The 3-digit EPA code which represents the Indian reservation or Alaska Remote Village being served by a Water System.

LCR_SAMPLE_RESULT.description: 90th percentile sample summary results data for lead or copper.

CONTAMINANT_CODE.description: A code value that represents a contaminant for which a public water system has incurred a violation of a primary drinking water regulation.

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

RESULT_SIGN_CODE.description: A sign used to indicate the detection limit reported for the data element Sample Measure.

SAMPLE_MEASURE.description: The result obtained from a sample analysis.

SAR_ID.description: A system-generated number managed by the reporting jurisdiction that uniquely identifies each Sample Result record. As there a situations where there can be two sample results for a sample, the SAR_ID is used instead of the Contaminant code (as in ODS) in the primary key of this table.

UNIT_OF_MEASURE.description: The unit of measure (UM) that is associated with the value reported for SAMPLE ANALYSIS RESULT.

LCR_SAMPLE.description: 90th percentile sample summaries data for lead or copper.

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

RECONCILIATION_ID.description: An identifier used for reconciliation with the state data system or LAB assigned identifiers.

SAMPLING_END_DATE.description: Date of the last day of the monitoring period in which 90th percentile data for lead or copper was acquired.

SAMPLING_START_DATE.description: Date of the first day of the monitoring period in which 90th percentile data for lead or copper was acquired.

SERVICE_AREA.description: A service area defines the sensitive populations that receive water from the water system.

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

IS_PRIMARY_SERVICE_AREA_CODE.description: Code indicating the type of primary service area served by the water system.

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

PWS_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: Code that indicates the activity status of the public water system.

PWS_TYPE_CODE.description: A system-generated coded value which classifies the water system according to federal requirements. It includes Community Water Systems (CWS), Non-Transient Non-Community Water Systems (NTNCWS), and Transient Non-Community Water Systems (TNCWS).

TREATMENT.description: Treatment objectives and process for treating water from a water system facility.

COMMENTS_TEXT.description: Describes a treatment combination or process.

FACILITY_ID.description: Water system facility ID that, when used with the PWSID, uniquely identifies a water system facility.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

TREATMENT_ID.description: Treatment ID that uniquely identifies a treatment process for this treatment plant.

TREATMENT_OBJECTIVE_Code.description: A code value that categorizes the treatment objective to be attained through treatment of a source of water.

TREATMENT_PROCESS_CODE.description: Code representing the treatment process used to obtain the treatment objective.

WATER_SYSTEM.description: Inventory information on public water systems.

ADDRESS_LINE1.description: The first line of an address applicable to a legal entity.

ADDRESS_LINE2.description: The second line of an address applicable to legal entity. This field is the street address, rural route, etc.

ADMIN_NAME.description: Name of the water system administrative contact - usually a person's name.

CITY_NAME.description: The city in which a legal entity is located.

COUNTRY_CODE.description: Two character abbreviation of the country code where the administrative contact is located.

DBPR_SCHEDULE_CAT_CODE.description: Stage 2 Disinfectant Byproducts Rule schedule category code.

EMAIL_ADDR.description: Email address of the administrative contact.

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

GW_SW_CODE.description: Indicates if the water system is considered having ground water (“gw”) or surface water (‘sw”) source under SDWA.

IS_GRANT_ELIGIBLE_IND.description: Code that indicates if the primacy agency has reported the minimum necessary data elements for this water system to include it in grant calculations.

IS_SCHOOL_OR_DAYCARE_IND.description: Code that indicates if the water system’s primary service area is a school or daycare as defined by EPA/OGWDW.

IS_WHOLESALER_IND.description: Code that indicates whether the system is a wholesaler of water. This value is copied from PWSWholeSaleInd value from ODS.

LT2_SCHEDULE_CAT_CODE.description: Code that identifies the category for LT2 schedule.

ORG_NAME.description: The organization to which the legal entity is associated.

OUTSTANDING_PERFORMER.description: N - The water system did not meet the outstanding performer criteria according to state policy. Y - The water system met the outstanding performer criteria according to state policy.

OUTSTANDING_PERFORM_BEGIN_DATE.description: Date water system met the outstanding performer criteria according to state policy.

OWNER_TYPE_CODE.description: Code that dentifies the ownership category of the water system consisting of: F (Federal Government), L (Local Government), M (Public/Private), N (Native American), P (Private), or S (State Government).

PHONE_EXT_NUMBER.description: The telephone extension of the administrative contact.

PHONE_NUMBER.description: The telephone number of a water system or the system's primary contact. Format: (AAA)-EEE-NNNN where: AAA = the telephone area code, EEE = the telephone exchange, an d NNNN = the telephone number. Where multiple facilities exist for a water system at different physical locations, phone number identifies the telephone number which is applicable to the primary facility of, or the principal contact for, the system.

POPULATION_SERVED_COUNT.description: Water system’s estimate of the number of people served by the system.

POP_CAT_11_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

POP_CAT_2_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

POP_CAT_3_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

POP_CAT_4_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

POP_CAT_5_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PRIMACY_TYPE.description: Code that indicates if the water system is regulated by a state, tribal, or territorial primacy program. Note that EPA direct implementation programs, except for Wyoming, are tribal primacy programs.

PRIMARY_SOURCE_CODE.description: The code showing the differentiation between the sources of water: ground water (GW),groundwater purchased (GWP), surface water (SW), surface water purchased (SWP), groundwater under influence of surface water (GU), or purchased ground water under influence of surface water source (GUP).

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

PWS_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: Code that indicates the activity status of the public water system.

PWS_DEACTIVATION_DATE.description: The date in which the water system was reported as being closed/deactivated.

PWS_NAME.description: The name of the water system. The name can be the formal, legal, or common name that is used most generally in referring to the water system. When multiple facilities exist for the water system at different physical locations, the name identifies the means by which the system, as a whole, is generally known.

PWS_TYPE_CODE.description: A system-generated coded value which classifies the water system according to federal requirements. It includes Community Water Systems (CWS), Non-Transient Non-Community Water Systems (NTNCWS), and Transient Non-Community Water Systems (TNCWS).

SEASON_BEGIN_DATE.description: If this is a seasonal water system (not open year-round), this column will contain the opening month and day of the period of time when the water system serves water. The column is NULL if the water system serves water year-round.

SEASON_END_DATE.description: If this is a seasonal water system (not open year-round), this column will contain the ending month and day of the period of time when the water system serves water. The column is NULL if the water system serves water year-round.

SERVICE_CONNECTIONS_COUNT.description: Number of service connections to the water system.

SOURCE_PROTECTION_BEGIN_DATE.description: Date water system substantially implemented source water protection according to state policy.

SOURCE_WATER_PROTECTION_CODE.description: N - The water system has not implemented source water protection according to state policy. Y - The water system has substantially implemented source water protection according to state policy.

STATE_CODE.description: A coded value that represents the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) State abbreviation in which a legal entity is located. Must be one of the USPS Postal State Codes.

SUBMISSION_STATUS_CODE.description: Code that indicates whether an active water system was reported, rejected, or not reported during the recent inventory submission. This field is not applicable to inactive water systems. Y for reported and accepted, U for unreported, and R for reported, but rejected. Generated by ODS.

ZIP_CODE.description: The U.S. Postal Service (USPS) ZIP code in which a legal entity is loc ated. Format: ZZZZZEEEE where: ZZZZZ = the ZIP code and EEEE = the optional ZIP+4 extension.

WATER_SYSTEM_FACILITY.description: Inventory information on public water system facilities.

AVAILABILITY_CODE.description: Code for how the source water is utilized by a water system. E(emergency), I (interim), O(other), P(permanent), S(seasonal).

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

FACILITY_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: The value of this attribute indicates the status of the facility.

FACILITY_DEACTIVATION_DATE.description: Date when the water system was deactivated (water no longer actively serving water) or removed from federal oversight because it no longer met SDWA criteria as a public water system.

FACILITY_ID.description: Water system facility ID that, when used with the PWSID, uniquely identifies a water system facility.

FACILITY_TYPE_CODE.description: Code that Indicates the type of water system facility.

FILTRATION_STATUS_CODE.description: A code reported by the state to indicate whether a non-emergency surface water source or a nonemergency ground water under the influence of surface water source is required to install filtration by a certain date or is successfully avoiding filtration.

IS_SOURCE_IND.description: Y - Water System Facility is designated a source (either a Consecutive Connection (CC), Infiltration Gallery (IG), Intake (IN), Non-piped (NP), Roof Catchment (RC), Reservoir (RS), Spring (SP), Well (WL), or Non-piped non-purchased (NN)).

IS_SOURCE_TREATED_IND.description: An indicator associated with a water  system source facility used to specify that a source is or is not being treated. N - Not Treated Y -  Treated.

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

PWS_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: Code that indicates the activity status of the public water system.

PWS_DEACTIVATION_DATE.description: The date in which the water system was reported as being closed/deactivated.

PWS_TYPE_CODE.description: A system-generated coded value which classifies the water system according to federal requirements. It includes Community Water Systems (CWS), Non-Transient Non-Community Water Systems (NTNCWS), and Transient Non-Community Water Systems (TNCWS).

SELLER_PWSID.description: PWSID of the water system that is selling water to this system through this interconnection. Is also the "upstream" water system to the parent of this facility.

SELLER_PWS_NAME.description: PWS Name of the water system that is selling water to this system through this interconnection. Is also the "upstream" water system to the parent of this facility.

SELLER_TREATMENT_CODE.description: Code that indicates whether the seller is or is not treating the source or whether the seller treatment status is unknown.  Applies only to source facilities.

STATE_FACILITY_ID.description: The ID that a state uses to identify a facility in their own state system database.

SUBMISSION_STATUS_CODE.description: Code that indicates whether an active water system was reported, rejected, or not reported during the recent inventory submission. This field is not applicable to inactive water systems. Y for reported and accepted, U for unreported, and R for reported, but rejected. Generated by ODS.

WATER_TYPE_CODE.description: Indicates the source of the water - GW for Ground Water, SU for surface water, or GU for ground water under the influence of surface water.

VIOLATION.description: Documents a breach of a requirement. Violations are detected by assessment of sample results or reviews (including on site visits). Violations may lead to legal actions or compliance orders. Violations are publicized, when required, by public notification. Violations may be remedied by compliance/enforcement remedies, such as improved filtration techniques or changes in procedures. Examples: Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL) violations, failure to replace lead service lines, monitoring and reporting violations, treatment technique violations, and procedural violations. Example descriptors: type, date, description, severity, and recommended corrective action(s) to include milestones. Description: Documents a breach of a requirement. Violations are detected by assessment of sample results or reviews (including on site visits). Violations may lead to legal actions or compliance orders. Violations are publicized, when required, by public notification. Violations may be remedied by compliance/enforcement remedies, such as improved filtration techniques or changes in procedures. Examples: Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL) violations, failure to replace lead service lines, monitoring and reporting violations, treatment technique violations, and procedural violations. Example descriptors: type, date, description, severity, and recommended corrective action(s) to include milestones.

COMPLIANCE_STATUS_CODE.description: Code indicating the current status of violation.

COMPL_PER_BEGIN_DATE.description: Compliance Period Begin Date - represents the beginning of a  period of time when a public water system was in violation of a primary drinking water regulation. This may also be the date when the public water system missed a monitoring event or the date when the public water system failed to complete a required action (for example, failing to install new treatment technology by a required date).

COMPL_PER_END_DATE.description: Compliance Period End date - The calendar date of the end of a monitoring period in which a public water system was in violation of a primary drinking water regulation.

CONTAMINANT_CODE.description: A code value that represents a contaminant for which a public water system has incurred a violation of a primary drinking water regulation.

CORRECTIVE_ACTION_ID.description: Contains an identifying value referencing a corrective action in the primacy agency’s system of record.  This column is conditionally mandatory based upon the type of violation per the rule reporting guidance.  As an example, both IESWTR and GWR require that when reporting a type 45 – failure to address a deficiency, that the corrective action prescribed to the water system by the primacy agency be reported with the violation (GWR 141.403(a)(4)).

EPA_REGION.description: The EPA Region in which the water system resides (01-10).

FACILITY_ID.description: Water system facility ID that, when used with the PWSID, uniquely identifies a water system facility.

IS_HEALTH_BASED_IND.description: Indicates if this is a health based violation (Y) or not (N).

IS_MAJOR_VIOL_IND.description: A code value that indicates the severity of a Monitoring and Reporting (M) violation, major or minor. The major versus minor designation does not apply to a sanitary survey M violation.

LATEST_ENFORCEMENT_ID.description: The most recent enforcement action taken against this violation.

ORIGINATOR_CODE.description: Code that indicates if the enforcement action was initiated by an EPA Region (R) or by a state, territory, or tribe (S).

POPULATION_SERVED_COUNT.description: Water system’s estimate of the number of people served by the system.

POP_CAT_5_CODE.description: Will equal 1 or 2; identifies the population category for water systems serving populations less than or greater than 10,000.

PRIMACY_AGENCY_CODE.description: Two character postal code for the state or territory having regulatory oversight for the water system. If the water system is regulated directly by EPA, this code will consist of the two-digit EPA Region number (01…10). The Navajo Nation has primacy over its water systems, so NN is used in this case.

PRIMARY_SOURCE_CODE.description: The code showing the differentiation between the sources of water: ground water (GW),groundwater purchased (GWP), surface water (SW), surface water purchased (SWP), groundwater under influence of surface water (GU), or purchased ground water under influence of surface water source (GUP).

PUBLIC_NOTIFICATION_TIER.description: Numeric code for Public Notification Tier for the violation.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

PWS_ACTIVITY_CODE.description: Code that indicates the activity status of the public water system.

PWS_DEACTIVATION_DATE.description: The date in which the water system was reported as being closed/deactivated.

PWS_TYPE_CODE.description: A system-generated coded value which classifies the water system according to federal requirements. It includes Community Water Systems (CWS), Non-Transient Non-Community Water Systems (NTNCWS), and Transient Non-Community Water Systems (TNCWS).

RTC_ENFORCEMENT_ID.description: The most recent Enforcement Action taken against this Violation to Return To Compliance (RTC).

RULE_CODE.description: Code for a National Primary Drinking Water rule.

RULE_GROUP_CODE.description: Code that uniquely identifies a rule group.

SAMPLE_RESULT_ID.description: A system-generated number managed by the reporting jurisdiction that uniquely identifies each Sample Result record.

SEVERITY_IND_CNT.description: A count indicating the severity of certain DBPR and IESWTR violations.

STATE_MCL.description: A numeric value that represents the maximum contaminant level which was exceeded that led to the identification of an MCL violation for a public water system.

UNIT_OF_MEASURE.description: The unit of measure (UM) that is associated with the value reported for SAMPLE ANALYSIS RESULT.

VIOLATION_CATEGORY_CODE.description: There are several categories of violations that may be reported in this database. These include Maximum Contaminant Level Violations (MCL), Maximum Residual Disinfectant Level (MRDL), Treatment Technique Violations (TT), and Monitoring and Reporting Violations (M/R).

VIOLATION_CODE.description: A coded value which categorizes a violation.

VIOLATION_ID.description: A designated attribute which, along with the water system ID (PWSID), uniquely identifies the violation.

VIOL_MEASURE.description: A numeric value that represents the analytical result of a contaminant that exceeded the Maximum Contaminant Level (MCL) for that contaminant. For contaminants that can be monitored with a reliable degree of accuracy, an MCL is set. For those which cannot be monitored reliably, a treatment technique is set instead. Both standards are set at a level sufficient to protect the public's health.

VIOLATION_ENF_ASSOC.description: Association between a violation and an enforcement action.

ENFORCEMENT_ID.description: A designed attribute which, along with the water system ID (PWSID), assures uniqueness of enforcement action.

PWSID.description: Uniquely identifies the water system within a specific state. Format: SSXXXXXXXXXX where: SS = the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) Pub 5-2 State abbreviation in which the water system is located, or the region number of the EPA region responsible for an Indian reser vation, and XXXXXXXXXX = the water system identification code assigned by the State.

VIOLATION_ID.description: A designated attribute which, along with the water system ID (PWSID), uniquely identifies the violation.
